title: Chinese Government provides $2 million grant to support School Feeding Program
description: According to internal records that the Government of Grenada shared with AidData in June 2018, the Chinese Government provided a $2,000,000 grant to the Government of Grenada in 2005 to support the implementation of the country’s School Feeding Program (PAE). The program was designed to provided primary and secondary school students of Grenada with adequate and better food, education on the nutritional value of local food, introduce school gardens/orchards, and provide equipment for these goals. Around 9,400 students were provided with a cooked lunch and may waive the fee dependent on need. There was no limit on the number of students who can receive a free meal.
staff_comments: 1. The main source (see Dropbox link) was provided to AidData by a Ministry of Finance official in Grenada.
combined_text:
# Sector
DEVELOPMENTAL FOOD AID/FOOD SECURITY ASSISTANCE

# Title
Chinese Government provides $2 million grant to support School Feeding Program

# Description
According to internal records that the Government of Grenada shared with AidData in June 2018, the Chinese Government provided a $2,000,000 grant to the Government of Grenada in 2005 to support the implementation of the country’s School Feeding Program (PAE). The program was designed to provided primary and secondary school students of Grenada with adequate and better food, education on the nutritional value of local food, introduce school gardens/orchards, and provide equipment for these goals. Around 9,400 students were provided with a cooked lunch and may waive the fee dependent on need. There was no limit on the number of students who can receive a free meal.
justification: Project focuses on food security and education without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: School feeding program, nutritional education, school gardens, no energy-related components

title: China Grants $1.5 million to Grenada's Cultural and Sporting Complex in 2005
description: In 2005, the Chinese government granted $1.5 million for the completion of Cultural and Sporting Complex of Grenada. The project seems to be under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Carriacou and Petite Martinique Affairs.
staff_comments: Document (dropbox) provided to Aiddata by Ministry of Finance of Grenada.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
China Grants $1.5 million to Grenada's Cultural and Sporting Complex in 2005

# Description
In 2005, the Chinese government granted $1.5 million for the completion of Cultural and Sporting Complex of Grenada. The project seems to be under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Carriacou and Petite Martinique Affairs.
justification: Project focuses on cultural and sporting infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Cultural and Sporting Complex, social infrastructure focus

title: Chinese Government provides $150,000 grant in 2005 for Hillsborough Recreation Facilities
description: According to internal records that the Government of Grenada shared with AidData in June 2018, the Chinese Government provided a $150,000 grant to the Government of Grenada in 2005 to support the Hillsborough Recreational Facility. Hillsborough Recreational Facility is one of the major playing fields of Grenada located in Carriacou. It is utilized for all major sporting events and functions. A 2012 newsletter notes that spectator amenities have been improved and bleachers were covered.
staff_comments: 1. The main source (see Dropbox link) was provided to AidData by a Ministry of Finance official in Grenada
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government provides $150,000 grant in 2005 for Hillsborough Recreation Facilities

# Description
According to internal records that the Government of Grenada shared with AidData in June 2018, the Chinese Government provided a $150,000 grant to the Government of Grenada in 2005 to support the Hillsborough Recreational Facility. Hillsborough Recreational Facility is one of the major playing fields of Grenada located in Carriacou. It is utilized for all major sporting events and functions. A 2012 newsletter notes that spectator amenities have been improved and bleachers were covered.
justification: Project focuses on recreational facilities without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Recreational facility development, sports field improvements, spectator amenities

title: $800,000 Chinese Government grant for Needy Students Programme for Uniforms, Books, and Lunches of Grenada in 2005
description: In 2005, China granted $800,000 to the Needy Students Programme for Uniforms, Books, and Lunches. The program provides assistance with items relevant to education to students at primary and tertiary levels.
staff_comments: Sources conflict over whether the funds go to the Needy Students Program for Uniforms, Books, and Lunches vs. the Needy Students Assistance Program which are two different programs.Document (dropbox) provided to Aiddata by Ministry of Finance of Grenada.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
$800,000 Chinese Government grant for Needy Students Programme for Uniforms, Books, and Lunches of Grenada in 2005

# Description
In 2005, China granted $800,000 to the Needy Students Programme for Uniforms, Books, and Lunches. The program provides assistance with items relevant to education to students at primary and tertiary levels.
justification: Project is focused on education support without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Education grant for student uniforms, books, and lunches

title: Chinese Government provides $110,000 grant in 2005 for Night Lighting Facilities
description: According to internal records that the Government of Grenada shared with AidData in June 2018, the Chinese Government provided a $110,000 grant to the Government of Grenada in 2005 for night lighting facilities. The night lighting facilities were to be installed at various playing fields across the country, facilitating sport development for the youth of Grenada.
staff_comments: 1. The main source (see Dropbox link) was provided to AidData by a Ministry of Finance official in Grenada.
